arm_group.description: Patients with Sjogren Syndrome related or non-Sjogren Syndrome related dry eye.

brief_summary.textblock:
To assess the reading function impairment in patients with dry eye and to assess the effects
      of reading on the ocular surface.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Impairment of Reading Ability in Dry Eye Patients and Effects of Sustained Reading on the Ocular Surface

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age of 50 or greater,

          -  literacy in English language,

          -  ability to give informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  binocular vision below 20/25,

          -  any ocular surgery within the last 3 months,

          -  mental issues,

          -  illiteracy,

          -  language problems which might possibly interfere with reading ability,

          -  history of taking or current use of topical prescription anti-inflammatory eyedrops
             (including, cyclosporine and steroids as well as any glaucoma eyedrops).

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with known dry eye as well as normal healthy control subjects with no ocular
        surface diseases will be recruited from the Ocular Surface Diseases and Dry Eye Clinic as
        well as Glaucoma Clinic of the Wilmer Eye Institute.

facility.name: The Wilmer Eye Institute, Johns Hopkins University

primary_outcome.description: Do individuals with dry eye have impaired sustained silent reading function when compared to controls?

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Is there a change in the Ocular Surface Score with reading as a stressor in patients with dry eye compared to controls?
Is there a change in osmolarity with reading as a stressor in patients with dry eye comparing to controls?
Is there a change in visual acuity and contrast sensitivity with reading as a stressor in patients with dry eye comparing to controls?
Identification of various inflammatory cytokines in tear film of dry eye patients comparing to controls and the effect of sustained reading to the levels of these cytokines.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
